text: I solved the problem the dirty way, i force ignore error
Thanks for the link!

For the issue of not checking duplicate company when inserting via api i make an idea post on community portal, if you want this issue to be resolved you can upvote here :
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/API-Primary-key-check-when-insert-company/idi-p/380486>
I think it’s a point to improve on the api
What do you think about this improvement guys ?

Sorry I didn’t see this yesterday. The search API currently operates differently from our other APIs where filter critera expect unix timestamps. There is an open issue to fix this but there are some bigger performance issues the team needs to tackle first, those ideally would allow us to let a higher request limit than the current 4/second.

To make sure I’m understanding the issue correctly, you are saying that filtering `closedate` s only works when you using the GT(E) operateros but not when you are looking for deals that closed before a certain timestamp?

Are you seeing any other properties behave this way, or just `closedate` ?

Hey <@U01DF3PNCKA> for whatever reason that link isn’t working for me but I think I can guess at the general idea. If you check the “creating your own unique Id” second of the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/understanding-the-crm|understanding the CRM page> you can create a property that HubSpot will deduplicate agains for cases where you can’t or don’t want to use the HubSpot defined Ids. Let me know if that doesn’t answer your question though

Actually they consider my idea proposal as spam, don’t know why.... THat’s why the link is actually unreachable

About your answer, i actually have to time to try , i’m implementing a dirty process making search before each insert to find if company exist. But i think that if HubSpot api don’t check their own primary index their is few chance they check custom one. I keep your link in my todo list to make a try when my main development is finished, so that i can try some R&D improvement on it
<@UD53A9UUR> can you help us understand why this post got marked as spam?
i think it’s because of multiple edit, i have some format issue so i make lot of edit
Yeah, I think the multiple edits is what caused the issue.  Should be available now

Hey <@U01CWP44QKX> by chance do you have your IP address excluded from HubSpot analytics?  It’s most common when working from offices where customers wants to make sure internal traffic doesn’t mess with their overall numbers.

Also, to be clear, IP address isn’t used for web analytics tracking. So you could still be seeing page views from the cookie even if the IP address isn’t tracked
Thanks <@UD53A9UUR>, does this kind of feedback is enough for you or it need some improvment ?
Looks good to me :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey <@U01D4K3RSNQ> You can request the property history using the `propertyValue` param in the v1 API. Here is an example: <https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/lists/all/contacts/all?hapikey=demo&property=HubSpotscore&propertyMode=value_and_history>
Is it possible to get an api relating to cricket that gives live scores ??
awesome thanks zack
this is exactly what i needed

Hey <@UFBNA9K9A> I don’t have my IP excluded, and the IP I’m passing via the API is a random one from the user’s region so as not to change their IP Location data that HubSpot captures.

The Form Submission is coming into HubSpot, just that even with the tracking cookie/token it’s still saying no tracking info received as you can see in the screenshot below.
This may just be for the screenshot but it looks like `hs_context` is commented out when you are building the `data` dictionary
oh shit, you’re right!! rookie mistake :face_palm: thank you for catching that…going to try this again lol
Nice, the errors about missing cookie and Ip are gone, but contacts don’t appear to have any additional tracking info unfortunately :disappointed:

what dditional tracking info are you looking for?  I would expect to see a pageview on the timeline at least to make sure the tracking is working as expected. This is assume the page is on some kind of page

Hi <@UFBNA9K9A> ! I'm working with <@U01CWP44QKX> through support and can confirm that there is no usertoken (thru daddams) for some of the contacts so original source drill down 1 is showing Unknown URL.
I’m assuming those are for contacts submitted after the uncommenting?

No page views or changes to “First Page Seen”, Original Source, the drilldowns, etc. :disappointed:

The contacts that get created with tracking info in HubSpot at the very least point to the signup page as the First Page Seen with a Page view on that page.

If I send over the usertoken/cookie I have for the users we captured the token but HubSpot wasn’t able to attribute them, are you able to see what kind of info is available for those tokens on your end?

<@U012W4YEUTX> I solved the problem pretty much right after i posted the comment (as usually happens, amirite?) I didn't have the fields created in the HS form inside of HS, so the form couldn't actually receive the submissions. After I created the form inside HS everything worked as intended.
I’m expecting it’s not possible and then my client will decide on my nice modal. :slightly_smiling_face:
